metadata.description:
reamus music is very clear, silent and fragile. a hypertrip into futuristic worlds yet unknown. this visionary spatial field let us glance at 2063. the release comes in a very closed aestatic way, including the tracknaming, the music itself and the marvelous coverartwork from yuan peng.
in 'nine days' all just happens about some very basic rhym-patterns, that are formed by sone samples. this is an adventurous trip into sci.fi and HAL9000, carried away by organ, ringmodulated and violalike sweeping sounds. the form is structural readable, far away from digital, urbanism and other modern metaphers. scapish music how we like it!
the artwork is able in an a4-version for the homeprinter and right exclusive an a3 cd-inlet mini-poster artwork for people who are able to print on a3.
metadata.title: reamus - nine days [63LP003]
metadata.subject: Ambient;Microsound;Abstract;scape
